Counsel:  [*1] Melissa Devich Cochran, Esquire Counsel for Defendant, UNITED TECHNOLOGIES 
CORPORATION, Incorrectly sued as "United Technologies Corporation, in its own right and its wholly-owned 
subsidiary, Inmont Corporation".
Carla Guttilla, Esquire PABID #69476 Houston, Texas Attorney for Plaintiffs.

Counsel:
2015 Pa. Dist. & Cnty. Dec. LEXIS 16760, *114

 
United Technologies Corporation ("UTC") was recently served with the enclosed summons and first amended 
complaint in the Staples matter pending in Allegheny County, Pennsylvania. Through our review of the case 
materials, we have determined that the basis for Plaintiffs’ claims against UTC is Mr. Staples’ allegation that he 
worked between 1979-1983 as a contractor at a facility in Belvidere, New Jersey that he says was owned initially by 
Celanese Corporation, and then “evolved into Inmont and then BASF.” As you may know, BASF purchased Inmont 
Corporation from LTTC via a Stock Purchase Agreement dated May 14, 1985. We understand that BASF is 
separately named and has appeared in this case.
Based on the foregoing, and pursuant to the Stock Purchase Agreement, UTC tenders its defense and indemnity in
